sentences.sentence: Letters to the editor: our readers share their views.

Please send your letters toletters@independent.co.ukWe now know that there was a "boozy party" in10 Downing Streeton 18 December 2020, while the rest of the country was in the middle of a tier 3 Covid lockdown imposed by Boris Johnson'sgovernment.On the day of the Downing Street party, 514 people were reported to have died from coronavirus.Some, perhaps most, would have died alone, and were denied the comforting presence of family and friends by order of the lockdown.The Tories had a party at10 Downing Streetwhile their hypocritical home secretary Priti Patel went on television to tell the public that if there was a "big party taking place" then "it would be right to call the police".This scandal is the latest in a never-ending series of scandals that has characterisedBoris Johnson's premiership.How many more scandals will it take before enough is enough and Johnson and his cabinet face justice?How much more filth needs to accumulate in the Tory stables before the sh*t is cleaned out?Sasha SimicLondonSustainable ChristmasAn estimated 120 milliontrees are going to be cut down around the world just for this Christmas.
And an even greater number of trees will be chopped down next year for the festive season alone.Something must change.

Trees are the earth's first line of defence against the climate crisis, devastating rising water levels, floods, and other erratic weather patterns like droughts and desertification.If you have never done anything to fight climate change, skipping a Christmas tree is a good chance to start.

Or think ahead and plant your Xmas tree instead, and start having an eco-conscious Merry Christmas.Hussein Lumumba AminKampala, UgandaAustrian lockdownThe Austrian government is right to lift lockdownonly for the vaccinatedpart of the population.

In these times, when Europe is once again becoming the epicentre of Covid-19, Austria is the first country in Europe to make such a distinction between vaccinated and unvaccinated.The unvaccinated people who use the "freedom to choose" argument to justify their decision to not get the jab, forget that living in society means that they cannot use their freedom as they please, especially when it conflicts with security.

This is precisely what the Austrian government is doing with this plan: protecting the citizens who follow the rules (get the vaccine) to guarantee safety/security and restrict access to society for the free riders (unvaccinated) who try to benefit from the system without playing their role.Tristan GiletNewcastle Upon TyneOne rule for themOf course, theDowning Streetparty was within the rules.

A special regulation had been passed declaring Downing Street to be a temporary outpost of Barnard Castle, and we all know that the rules don't apply there.PJ JohnstonHexhamNational humiliationIn just one day we listen to the news about the Christmas party at No 10 last year and the catastrophic evacuation of Afghanistan.We hear them joke, laugh and their denials.Personally, I was unable to see my 92-year-old mother, my two daughters and my granddaughter.
Will I take any new restrictions seriously?
Probably not.To express my disappointment seems to be pointless.
Having faced several years of untruths, distorted information and blatant arrogance, why am I really surprised?This government is anational humiliation.

I look forward to Boris Johnson one day going so I can vote Conservative again.Tony HowarthLondonRead MoreWhen even Ant and Dec are poking fun, you know you've been rumbledChristmas party loophole or not, Boris Johnson is on his way out | Sean O'GradyBoris Johnson's full apology: sorry, not sorry, nothing to do with me | John RentoulOpinion: Johnson's political epitaph?

One rule for us, another for everyone elseJohnson's two most shameful lies just blew up in the most spectacular way | Tom PeckWhat voters actually want levelling up to achieve is pretty simple | Ed Dorrell

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: Letters to the editor: our readers share their views. Please send your letters toletters@independent.co.ukWe now know that there was a "boozy party" in10 Downing Streeton 18 December 2020, while the rest of the country was in the middle of a tier 3 Covid lockdown imposed by Boris Johnson'sgovernment.On the day of the Downing Street party, 514 people were reported to have died from coronavirus.Some, perhaps most, would have died alone, and were denied the comforting presence of family and friends by order of the lockdown.The Tories had a party at10 Downing Streetwhile their hypocritical home secretary Priti Patel went on television to tell the public that if there was a "big party taking place" then "it would be right to call the police".This scandal is the latest in a never-ending series of scandals that has characterisedBoris Johnson's premiership.How many more scandals will it take before enough is enough and Johnson and his cabinet face justice?How much more filth needs to accumulate in the Tory stables before the sh*t is cleaned out?Sasha SimicLondonSustainable ChristmasAn estimated 120 milliontrees are going to be cut down around the world just for this Christmas. Trees are the earth's first line of defence against the climate crisis, devastating rising water levels, floods, and other erratic weather patterns like droughts and desertification.If you have never done anything to fight climate change, skipping a Christmas tree is a good chance to start. Having faced several years of untruths, distorted information and blatant arrogance, why am I really surprised?This government is anational humiliation.
